Text: I’m excited to announce my Constituents of the Month, Cynthia and W.B. May! As Navy veterans and owners of Cynthia’s Artistic Expressions in Oceanside, they’ve done incredible work to help veterans and others heal through art. Read more about them here: https://t.co/t3E87r5Vgd

The American people would have more faith in their elected officials if they knew that they're focused on serving the public's best interests and not lining their own pockets. It’s time to ban members of Congress from trading stocks.
https://t.co/ZJNJa99ppD
https://t.co/2yLARdpeJM
Big Oil is taking in record profits while we pay for it at the pump. It’s time to crack down on this corporate greed and end fossil fuel subsidies. https://t.co/5CP1ozJMRe

The escalating situation in Ukraine is extremely troubling. While I continue to hope for a diplomatic resolution, I fully support the Biden Administration's preparations to ensure Russia pays a swift and severe price for any invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/DzEbFlAY9z

I had a productive meeting with @OCSheriffBarnes today on how we can crack down on fentanyl reaching Orange County and expand behavioral health options for people struggling with substance abuse. We’ll keep working together to keep our communities safe.

This is an incredibly tragic story, and my heart goes out to the Stonum family. 

Please heed this father’s advice to trust the science and get vaccinated. It can save your life. https://t.co/mmSBwHvZ0z

Thanks to @CueHealth for the tour of their impressive facility in Vista yesterday. They’re one of many leading health care and technology companies that call #CA49 home, and it was great to learn more about their innovative work. https://t.co/zPJr62zzLr

Thank you to everyone who sent in cards for our Valentines for Vets program! I love to show off our community’s support for veterans each #ValentinesDay. The best thing we can do is strengthen the benefits and services our vets depend on, and that's what I'm focused on. https://t.co/carznyg9mH

Four years ago today, a gunman at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School took the lives of 17 innocent people in a horrific act of gun violence. As we keep them and their loved ones in our hearts today, we must also recommit to acting on the epidemic of gun violence in our country.
Getting ready to watch my @RamsNFL with the family! Hope my kids don’t have to wait as long as I have to see them win one in LA! #SuperBowl https://t.co/HtkzXDixcp

I want to commend Carlsbad native @shaunwhite on an extraordinary Olympic career. Through five Winter Olympics appearances and three gold medal performances, Shaun inspired us all and made our #CA49 community proud. https://t.co/X4ykm35Ele

It makes no sense to leave nuclear waste near millions of people, active earthquake fault lines, and a critical military base. I’m leading this bipartisan bill to make sure the waste at San Onofre is some of the first to go. https://t.co/sGcnAQUJIS

I continue to closely monitor the brush fire in nearby Laguna Beach, and I'm very grateful for the hard work Orange County firefighters are doing to protect surrounding communities. Please continue to follow evacuation orders and other guidance from @OCFireAuthority. https://t.co/JXrEOFzJ84

California is receiving more than $56 million from the bipartisan infrastructure law this year to build out electric vehicle charging infrastructure, with more funding soon! 

CA leads the country in EV adoption and this funding will help us keep going! https://t.co/PisVhttVuC https://t.co/T3SQcHsbMB

I'm also glad this is now a bipartisan effort with my colleagues throughout the region. Thanks to @repdarrellissa, @RepScottPeters, @RepSteel, @RepKatiePorter, and @RepYoungKim for signing on. Let's get this done for Southern California! https://t.co/677xLjhniI

Today I’m reintroducing my bill to make sure the federal government prioritizes San Onofre for the removal of nuclear waste. With millions of people living nearby, earthquake fault lines in the area, and national security risks associated with Camp Pendleton, this is commonsense.

Great meeting with local members of @NALC_National after we passed the #PostalServiceReformAct earlier this week! Americans depend on the @USPS for life-saving medications and so much more. I'll keep fighting to protect the Postal Service and its dedicated carriers. https://t.co/WqExZAfT1N
Huge congratulations to #CA49 resident @LindsJacobellis on winning the gold in snowboardcross - the first American gold medalist at the games! https://t.co/JboW46z6B1

I was thrilled to host one our previous Constituents of the Month, Erica Alfaro, with the National Council of Agricultural Employers today. Erica does incredible work advocating for farmworkers’ rights and inspiring young people. Read her story here: https://t.co/ej7Ful00dU https://t.co/p4RcavfFqZ

When we prioritize justice, equity, diversity, and inclusion in the policymaking process, we achieve better outcomes for all Americans. Yesterday's @NRDems hearing highlighted how we must do more to elevate those principles when we’re making environmental policy. https://t.co/lXjF8P8zg5

Had a great listening session today with @VFWHQ, @DAVHQ, @PVA1946, @GIBillRights, and @studentvets. We’ve made a lot of progress for vets over the last few years, but there’s much more work to do! Looking forward to building on that work with my @VetAffairsDems colleagues. https://t.co/VufXer5mP7

It’s #SaferInternetDay, and there’s no better time for @YouTube to remove dangerous content that puts children at risk. With suicide rates among young people on the rise, YouTube needs to listen to @RepSusanWild’s call to remove "How To Tie a Noose" videos and content like it.

Taxpayer advocates play an important role ensuring the IRS treats you fairly. Today, I met with @YourVoiceAtIRS advocate Michelle Breed from San Diego to learn more about the challenges she’s hearing from taxpayers and how we can make the IRS work better for everyone. https://t.co/QhiuzWjNvB

California’s infrastructure earned a C-minus grade from the American Society of Civil Engineers. 

About 1,500 bridges in our state are rated “poor.” 

Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law, help is on the way. https://t.co/mq0ZizPOXO

My bill to expand renewable energy development will help us combat the climate crisis AND create the clean energy jobs of the future right here in America. Glad to see that legislation pass the House last week as part of the America COMPETES Act. https://t.co/r85P0B126A

It was my pleasure to host @MiraCosta College President Dr. Sunita Cooke in Washington today. We'll keep working together to strengthen career and technical education, lower costs for students by expanding Pell Grants, and much more. https://t.co/IQHONOQLTf

My thoughts and prayers are with the loved ones of Seaman Kyle Mullen during this incredibly difficult time. It’s critically important that we learn more about his cause of death and work to prevent similar tragedies moving forward. https://t.co/OcLgClVvJI

We celebrate #TransitEquityDay on Rosa Parks’ birthday to commemorate her leadership, legacy, and courage to refuse giving up her seat on that Montgomery bus. In her honor, we must ensure equitable access to public transit for all. https://t.co/0nOroUYPvV

“Employers added a record 6.6 million jobs during Joe Biden's first 12 months in office, by far the strongest record of any president's first year in office.” #BidenBoom
https://t.co/luSw2WN4IT
https://t.co/otOjrspo6T

I’m proud to see the America COMPETES Act pass the House, which includes my Public Land Renewable Energy Development Act. With this legislation, the United States can lead in clean energy and reap the economic rewards. I’ll continue to fight for passage in the Senate.
It was another productive week in Washington. I have a few things to update you on, including an exciting holiday program for our veterans. https://t.co/YQzAQqrRgI

Vet Centers are critical for servicemembers’ and veterans’ mental health. I asked @DeptVetAffairs in yesterday’s @VetAffairsDems hearing about a bill I helped pass last Congress to expand eligibility National Guard & Reserve members – glad to hear it’s made a positive impact. https://t.co/OWTLzo6ZGj

FYI for all who are enrolled in Medicare! Rapid at-home COVID tests are now covered.
https://t.co/Bdfh4Imhdd

Thank you @POTUS and @EPA for pushing back on Postmaster DeJoy’s disastrous fleet plans. First DeJoy undermines our mail system and now our climate goals? Unbelievable. He should be fired.
https://t.co/Njx69c1Uqx

United States military forces successfully eliminated the global terrorist leader of ISIS. Thank you President Biden for your strong leadership and our brave troops for carrying out a mission that helps keep the American people and the world safe.
https://t.co/OLefGerOgf
Constituents with questions about Valentines for Veterans should contact program coordinator Gabriela Ochoa at gabriela.ochoa@mail.house.gov.

Let’s show some love to our veterans with my annual 💌 Valentines for Vets 💌 program! Constituents of all ages are encouraged to participate! See below for more details.

Note: Valentines should be delivered in unsealed envelopes. 💝 https://t.co/5EiyFIbDW8

Veteran suicide prevention remains a top priority for @VetAffairsDems. Today, we advanced the bipartisan STRONG Veterans Act to support veterans’ mental health as well as the RAISE Act, which helps @DeptVetAffairs competitively recruit and retain vital health care workers.

During #BlackHistoryMonth we recognize the strength and achievements of Black Americans. Let's use this time to honor the history makers overlooked and the stories untold, because Black history is American history.

Wonderful news—@POTUS’ cancer "moonshot" program is restarting. I know this hits close to home for the President and many others with similar stories. Cancer patients, survivors, and loved ones can find renewed hope in this initiative.
https://t.co/gVTzupDvTq

Since we passed the bipartisan infrastructure law, I've visited over 30 potential project sites and hosted over 20 roundtables and discussions on how the law will positively impact #CA49. The bipartisan infrastructure law will be a gamechanger for our residents and communities.

Today marks the start of #GunViolenceSurvivorsWeek. I'm thinking of all the survivors who have stood up and used their voices to speak out against gun violence. But these survivors deserve more. 

To truly honor them, we must take action to end gun violence one and for all. https://t.co/lvVWPhCIHt

OTD: President Lincoln signed a resolution abolishing slavery in the US, later becoming the 13th Amendment. On #NationalFreedomDay, we celebrate this monumental moment and reflect on the work we still have to ensure freedom, liberty, and justice for ALL.
https://t.co/NTqdL7N9dm

Sending positive thoughts to Senator Ben Ray Luján and his family right now. I know he's tough as nails and it's no surprise he expects to make a full recovery. We're thinking about you, @SenatorLujan. https://t.co/yvECQkVsZy

We have seen the damaging results of climate change all across the country with extreme weather events and natural disasters. This issue isn’t going away. In fact, it's getting worse. We must act now.
https://t.co/lBkhtktn9q
To everyone celebrating #LunarNewYear in South OC, North County SD, and across America, may the Year of the Tiger be filled with blessings, good fortune, and happiness! https://t.co/OJSBI59HRN

Great news! @Interior announced that California will receive funding from the bipartisan infrastructure law to clean up orphaned oil and gas wells. This effort will cut pollution from one of the largest sources of methane emissions in our communities.
https://t.co/EZTFqzvxV3

Climate change isn’t a red or blue issue—it affects ALL of us. We can’t go halfway in protecting our health or the planet. That’s why I led 22 of my colleagues in urging @POTUS to retain strong climate provisions in any comprehensive legislative proposal.
https://t.co/NabUpchYjo

The enhanced #ChildTaxCredit drastically reduced child poverty and helped millions of families make ends meet. We are already seeing the harmful results of not extending this support for children and families. We must make it permanent.
https://t.co/85bFMKbH8G
https://t.co/RwWwGpndBD

House Democrats have worked consistently to pass consequential climate change legislation for the future of our nation and our planet, but we can't let up steam. We must act now. That's why my colleagues and I are urging @POTUS to retain climate investments in #BuildBackBetter. https://t.co/5dKLhyvUov

The railroad bridge currently isn’t double tracked, an addition that would be huge for the community. I am hopeful that the bipartisan infrastructure law will help us with this project to make commuting easier for residents. https://t.co/GPm5AAXWY9

I can help with that—it’s called building back better.
https://t.co/7g246cOCqH

The Coast Highway bridge here in Oceanside was built in 1927 and its steel truss structure can no longer support the weight it needs to. This bridge is exactly the type of project that the bipartisan infrastructure law is designed to help fix. https://t.co/XfUKbqCQnc
¿Reúne usted los requisitos del #EITC? Más información aquí: https://t.co/Wr6SOiIC1T
Do you qualify for #EITC? Find out more here: https://t.co/KGffd8tOzM

One year ago, the Biden-Harris administration rescinded the dangerous #GlobalGagRule. While we celebrate this important action, it's only the beginning. We must make this repeal permanent to protect the reproductive rights of women around the world and advance gender equality. https://t.co/szBxnwiA5m

The pandemic placed a significant strain on the IRS, causing delays in processing returns. This is frustrating and concerning for many of my constituents. I joined my colleagues in urging @SecYellen to address this issue. https://t.co/tzDNTSaaVM

Thanks to the CARES Act, the @FCC announced @vcchealthcare will receive funding for equipment to expand telehealth services, along with monitors for providers to track patient health and reduce barriers to care.
https://t.co/aPtsk8xviX

I’m glad to see this decision—scamming Americans out of their money for campaign donations is deplorable. That is why I introduced my Uncheck the Box Act to increase the integrity and honesty of federal campaigns.
https://t.co/fO6NvZ222K

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we mourn the six million Jews and countless others who were brutally murdered during one of the darkest chapters in human history. It’s on each of us to keep their memory alive. We must also consciously work to end antisemitism and hate in all forms.

President Biden’s first year in office was the strongest year for economic growth since 1984! Let’s continue adding to this success by passing the #BuildBackBetter Act.
https://t.co/P8xI9u65tK

Many of our roads and bridges are crumbling, our water infrastructure is out of date, and highways like the interchange between the 5 & the 78 are in desperate need of improvements. The bipartisan infrastructure law will address all of that, making life easier for Californians. https://t.co/dt21McNkGr

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will strengthen our economy, boost our supply chains, and advance our leadership on the world stage. Excited that this important legislation was introduced this week.
https://t.co/00k5mD3zsB

I’m excited to announce my January Constituents of the Month! The Seeliger brothers have done incredible work to get seniors in our community connected with their loved ones, and I’m grateful for the innovative service they provide. https://t.co/ovUbCPvxx1

Republicans are shamelessly asking the Supreme Court to gut the #CleanAirAct, which has helped protect the health of Americans for over half a century. 

I joined 190+ of my Democratic colleagues in an amicus brief defending clean air for every American.
https://t.co/CX6QJf5FTu

Thanks to all who joined me to discuss how the bipartisan infrastructure law can support local priorities like I-5/SR-78 Interchange improvements. Our infrastructure has suffered from a systemic lack of federal investment, and now we're going to make the long overdue upgrades! 🏗 https://t.co/lrrFFAvSDV

Another record breaking year for renewable energy growth! While this is great to see, we still have a long way to go in reaching our net zero carbon emissions goals. Let’s keep it up!
https://t.co/JR2xeTdYkL

Thank you @ETI569 for the tour! It’s an exciting time for job growth now that the bipartisan infrastructure plan is law, especially for those pursuing apprenticeships here at the institute. https://t.co/cAgITMq2d7

Addressing the #ClimateCrisis isn’t just about protecting the planet, it’s about protecting our children and public health.
https://t.co/ApyNY4fGTr

COVID-19 booster shots are safe, effective, and instrumental in protecting you from serious illness. Sign up for yours today at https://t.co/XHTzCgzQDZ.

The tunnel that takes you from the satellite parking lot to Oceanside Harbor is another great example of how we can make necessary structural updates with potential funding from the bipartisan infrastructure law. https://t.co/xHXOWfKhKB

Today is the 49th anniversary of Roe v. Wade, a landmark Supreme Court decision that protects the right to abortion. But it’s not enough--reproductive rights are still under attack. 

We must continue to not only protect reproductive freedom but expand on it. #Roe49

This week, the California Congressional delegation urged Senate Veterans' Affairs Committee leaders to swiftly advance my bill to rename the San Diego VA Medical Center. This is the least we can do for deserving women veterans whose service has gone unrecognized for far too long. https://t.co/sDjTJS9dOO
Don’t forget! You can now order free at home COVID-19 tests. Get yours today here: https://t.co/LqUBRlxA1g

There aren’t enough affordable homes to meet our housing demand. Any future iteration of the #BuildBackBetter Act must make historic investments in affordable housing to lower costs & reduce financial pressure on renters and homeowners. Let’s get it done.
https://t.co/G31DB3mI5C

Another great example of how the American Rescue Plan continues to support our #CA49 communities. Proud to have fought for this funding on the behalf of the district.
https://t.co/1rkbJJNRn1

Today I voted in support of the #EVEST Act, a bill to automatically enroll transitioning servicemembers into @DeptVetAffairs care. It’s on us to ensure our veterans have an easy transition process into civilian life that sets them up for success long after military service. https://t.co/0M3tlBeuQZ
Reminder: you have until the end of the month to enroll in health insurance! Get the coverage you need before the deadline! https://t.co/ZI9NjKufd3

I recently toured the South Coast Water District Tunnel Project here in Laguna Beach. As our communities grow, infrastructure updates like this one are critical to accommodate the increase in wastewater volume and avoid risks associated with years of deterioration. https://t.co/NuH1t8rAUw

This American Rescue Plan funding will provide housing for homeless and extremely low-income residents who are at risk of homelessness. Glad to see this important legislation working to keep our communities and residents safe and sheltered.
https://t.co/wzyQIGfUKP

The Oceanside pier is over 100 years old and in need of critical upgrades. The bipartisan infrastructure law could facilitate the necessary updates to this iconic local structure so that it stays around for many more generations to come. https://t.co/oSFPXpjmrd

Enjoyed a delicious lunch at What A Dish Café over the weekend! Loved chatting with the managers about their experience with the Restaurant Revitalization Fund Replenishment Act, a bill I supported to ensure local businesses can continue to flourish during the pandemic. https://t.co/vPV0SYI8kN

The commute between South OC and North County SD is one of the most heavily congested corridors of traffic along the 5 freeway. The bipartisan infrastructure law could go a long way in helping to expand HOV lanes to help alleviate the commuter gap between these two counties. https://t.co/MCHq7Fp7rp

#CA49 venues enrich the social fabric of our community, and I’m glad to see funding headed their way to endure the pandemic. I fought for this funding as part of COVID relief legislation in 2020, and later as part of the American Rescue Plan.
https://t.co/gdmOvAcYen
https://t.co/FL9fW4rcjy

Thrilled to announce the bipartisan infrastructure law will deliver funding for the Encinitas-Solana Beach project and the Oceanside Special Shoreline Study to help protect local beaches from dangerous erosion. Looking forward to seeing the sand replenishment work begin soon!

Yesterday I visited the @MiraCosta College Technology Career Institute. They prepare our workforce for careers in critical and growing sectors of our local economy, and I’m glad the bipartisan infrastructure law can help support these important educational opportunities. https://t.co/OYsAkNdABn

FYI: tax filing season starts on Monday, Jan. 24! 

Remember, if you received #ChildTaxCredit or Economic Impact Payments in 2021, keep an eye on your mailbox for detailed information on how to file from the IRS. https://t.co/IBvETHP9Xm

This is another great step forward from the Biden Administration in protecting public health, reducing pollution, and reaching our net-zero carbon emissions goals.
https://t.co/EZTFqzvxV3

Here’s how you can order yours: https://t.co/LqUBRlxA1g

We can see the devastating effects of sea level rise right here at Doheny State Beach. Support from the bipartisan infrastructure law can help to better protect these cherished public areas in Dana Point from further damage. https://t.co/QKanJBHW5d

It was an honor to join @NSDCNAACP this morning to reflect on the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. We must honor him not just with our words, but with our actions. We must honor him by securing the right of every American to participate in our democracy. #MLKDay https://t.co/8ILIn8SnL3

Today, we honor the life of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. To truly honor Dr. King, we must use not only words, but also actions. This means following his dream & working diligently to restore voting rights and protections for all Americans. #MLKDay https://t.co/HF6OVryQwo
Please be careful along our coast today and follow the guidance of local authorities. https://t.co/5ZbkHRXEav https://t.co/ggIMgTFQzG

https://t.co/cEQ4Eg5FTj

So encouraged to see these proud clean energy advocates show up to #SaveSolar yesterday! We must continue moving forward in our clean energy progress, not backwards. 

ICYMI, here’s my letter addressing this issue:https://t.co/cgeNpoZQjL https://t.co/WpPC3MKcfa
This week, I was thrilled that my Guard and Reserve GI Parity Bill passed with a broad bipartisan vote. Watch for more highlights: https://t.co/tFSd0zTeog

This weekend, millions of families will no longer have access to #ChildTaxCredit monthly payments. This critical lifeline drastically cut child poverty and helped countless families make ends meet. For many, this means food on the table or going hungry. Congress must extend it. https://t.co/XN2K5nImjS

If we reinvest in and reinvent our response to climate disasters, we can reduce future impact. Proud to cosponsor @repblumenauer’s Climate RESILIENCE Act to strengthen @fema’s approach to climate disasters.
2021 was the second-worst year for billion-dollar weather disasters in the U.S. Instead of being reactive, let's be proactive, and have a PLAN. It's time for #ClimateRESILIENCE

One of the top priorities in our district is the undergrounding of utilities. The bipartisan infrastructure law provides federal funds to help match state and local funding for these projects to help keep residents safe and avoid risks caused by above ground powerlines. https://t.co/Fpupz2Nr5H

Happy #KoreanAmericanDay! Today, we commemorate the arrival of the first Korean immigrants to the United States on January 13, 1903. Let’s celebrate the wonderful impact and contributions the Korean American community has had in #CA49 and all across our nation. https://t.co/DJYkoSVTTt

Huge thank you to San Diego Farm Bureau, @MellanoCompany, and West Coast Tomato Growers for coordinating this visit! Today, the House passed the #FreedomToVoteAct and #JohnLewisVotingRightsAct, bills to safeguard voting rights and our democracy. 

Now the Senate must step up to protect this sacred American right. #FightForVotingRights
https://t.co/BhzL0flHSl

National Guard and Reserve members protect our country, but they often don't receive the same benefits as other servicemembers. This week @HouseDemocrats passed my GI Bill Parity Act to bring fairness to the way GI Bill benefits are earned, so #EveryDayInUniformCounts.

With so much rapid economic development in our region, our infrastructure must also keep up. By widening Del Obispo with potential funds from the bipartisan infrastructure law, we can create better access for residents of the area to reach these businesses. https://t.co/bLSD2iQ3hK

Guard & Reserve members are increasingly taking on the same risks & doing the same jobs as their active duty counterparts. It’s time for us to step up & give them the benefits they have earned for protecting the American people. That’s what my bill will do.https://t.co/aBej0CflYz
